The Zandalari pride themselves on being the first to raise and train all of the most ferocious lizards on Azeroth.
Brutosaurs are used by the Zandalari Empire as both weapons of war and enormous, mobile trading posts.
These fierce beasts are entombed alongside kings so they may carry their masters through the afterlife.
One of the rarest of birds seen on the islands of the Great Sea, and a prized possession amongst traders, if they can capture it.
Once a little hatchling, raised into a mighty pterrordax by a loving handler. He never did learn to fly.
Native to Draenor, these wolves are preferred by the Mag'har for their ferocity, loyalty, and for something to snuggle on those cool winter nights.
The Mag'har bred clefthooves not only as sturdy pack animals, but also powerful instruments of war.
A loyal steed to the defenders of Ironforge.
A loyal steed to the defenders of Ironforge.
You don't get dogs hotter than this.
One of the last of the giant bats to escape Undercity following the siege of Lordaeron.
Riverbeasts are actually one of the most dangerous animals on Azeroth, despite their appearance.
A ship unlike any other, held aloft by a gift from an unknown kraken-faced god of the deeps.
The eternal twilight of the Underrot has robbed this crawg of all pigmentation.
One of the last of the great armored hippogryphs to escape the burning of Teldrassil, it carried the last few citizens it could to safety before collapsing of exhaustion.
Monstrous serpents riddled with corruption serve as mounts for N'zoth's high-ranking lieutenants in the Great Sea.
These pterrordax keep vigil for enemy fleets soaring above the coasts of Zandalar.
A swamp-dwelling subspecies of pterrordax known to feast on young bloodfeasters.
These brightly-colored fliers are rarely captured in the wild due to their naturally untrusting natures.
Orphaned during the rout of the Blood Trolls, this bloodswarmer has been retrained by Talanji's handlers.
Common to the dark forests of Drustvar, these gryphon are silent and swift. Their prowess at operating on their own or as mounts lends them to be used for ambush and shock tactics.
Tasked with keeping watch on the seas for approaching dangers, the Stormsong Coastwatchers fly constant patrols.
Only a few gryphons are selected to be Sea Scouts operating from flag ships in the fleet. Their long range reconnaissance is an integral part of Kul Tiran sea dominance.
The rays of the great sea can travel for many miles in great migratory patterns.
These icy minions come from an unknown plane far from this one.
The time between being stung and being enveloped and devoured is short enough to consider not swimming in the Great Sea.
The battle-hardened shell of this mighty beast can turn aside even the most hefty hammer or sharpened spear.
One of the Arathi horses, taken and broken by the Horde conquerors of Stromgarde.
A valiant steed on the Arathi Highlands, it knows no fear.
Little is known about the fate of the twilight dragonflight, though they seem to exist in numbers in Grim Batol to this day.
These mighty leapers have adapted to island life by learning to catch seagulls swooping through crags and fissures.
Qinsho wrought his eternal guardian from pure gold and imbued it with the resilience of the earth.
Pale-skinned direhorns are quite rare, justifying the expense.
The Witherbark warrior Beastrider Kama once cut bloody swathes of terror across the Arathi Highlands astride such a monster.
Likely stolen from Newstead in the Arathi Highlands, this stalwart little donkey was destined to be eaten by kobolds.
She's a clever girl.
Only a handful of these giant bats remain in the Arathi Highlands, carefully raised by the Witherbark forest trolls who first brought them here.
These coursers have long been known to exist, but only befriend those that have gone to great lengths for friendship.
The Legion experimented with the corruption of many different types of wildlife, such as this fiery bird species from a molten world.
Forged in a fiery hatred, the offspring of a nightmare and a dream, this steed feeds on grains grown with the tears of your enemies.
A favorite unit of the Lich King, both for its power as a siege weapon, and the satisfying sound of flung meat.
If you try to give it a belly scratch, you're asking for trouble.
The only thing these big cats bring home as gifts are the severed limbs of your enemies.
These skeletal steeds know no fear, eat no grains, and can travel impossible distances.
There are few other ways to ride in to battle that feature as many spikes and bones.
The Kul Tiran military prides itself on mastery of both sea, through a vast navy, and land, with armed cavalry.
Blackpaw was just hibernating, minding his own business, and then suddenly there was a warfront.
Ashenvale chimaeras were used frequently by the Kaldorei to decimate structures in battles against the humans, orcs, and undead.
Nothing frightens a kodo like seeing a bear with antlers.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Drop:|r Moxo the Beheader|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r Darkshore|n|n|cFFFFD200Drop:|r Athil Dewfire|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r Darkshore
Description_lang: Nightsabers are an integral part of the Kaldorei's army, serving as both mount and assault weapon in one.
A rare color for a nightsaber, and rarely seen, they are prized amongst huntresses.
The connection between a nightsaber and its hunter or huntress is nearly inseparable.
That squishing sound every time it takes a step? That's a feature.
No one makes giant, slimy spawns like Krag'wa the Huge.
These giant seahorses are naturally curious, and are often found exploring sunken ship wreckage for shiny things.
Stonehide elderhorns, one of the few types of moose to inhabit island climates, have thinner fur than most elderhorns.
The forsaken prefer the use of these bloodthirsty hunters, both for their speed as a mount, and the psychological effect they have on their enemies.
If he wasn't so full, you wouldn't have caught him.
One of the larger native dragon species on Azeroth, this subspecies subsists almost entirely on fish. And fishermen.
Something terrible happened in the lost town of Havenswood.
Captured from the desolate sands of Vol'dun, this mount is surprisingly docile in captivity.
Captured from the desolate sands of Vol'dun, this mount is surprisingly docile in captivity.
Once these elegant cats were only given to high-ranking priestesses of Elune, but now they ride into battle with all manner of champion, in the service of vengeance.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Drop:|r High Tinker Mekkatorque|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r Battle of Dazar'alor
Description_lang: Garishly sporting extreme amounts of goblin flair, Gallywix commissioned his Mech of Death to one up Mekkatorque in combat and more importantly in style.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Achievement:|r Glory of the Dazar'alor Raider|n|cFFFFD200Category:|r Dungeons & Raids|n
Description_lang: Soaring high above the Battle of Dazar'alor, these beasts are drawn to the most cunning of victors.
Though she commands a variety of magical powers, Jaina has always been most proficient at summoning powerful elementals of water and ice.
BRUCE!
Hogrus was first seen by Emperor Shaohao on the third day of his meditation, and is considered by the Pandaren to be a sign of good fortune to come to those who take action.

A fiercely intelligent and curious species, these fox-like creatures have travelled the Great Dark Beyond and found their way to Azeroth. Drawn to Azeroth's champions, they seek adventure and companionship.

An artist in the magical city of Dalaran fell asleep on her brush, and dreamed of painting a beautiful feathered dragon. Her artwork lept from the page, and when she awoke, she found it sleeping gently beside her.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Achievement: |rBattle for Azeroth Pathfinder, Part Two|n|cFFFFD200Category: |rBattle for Azeroth
Description_lang: Don't ask what happened to the first one -- Mechagon technology is still gnome technology!
A loyal steed to the holy crusaders of Zandalar.
King Mechagon's private aerial unit, complete with deployable blast cannon and foot warmers.
The check engine light is always on, it's when it goes off that you should be worried.
The Unshackled have a natural kinship with the species of the deep seas that have seen cruelty at the hands of the naga.
The Ankoan have been battling the naga for years, and with a natural affinity for the sea, training the local wildlife was a natural strategy.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Achievement:|r Glory of the Eternal Raider|n|cFFFFD200Category:|r Dungeons & Raids|n
Description_lang: The naga raised these rays in captivity, harvesting their gas organs to craft alchemy which allowed them to breathe air more easily.
Captured at a young age and raised to serve naga hunters, snapdragons are loyal and fierce companions.
Giant crabs are native to Nazjatar and a favored food of the naga. This one must have been well-kept to grow this large.
The X-995 is the ultimate in customizeable feline robo-companionship.

"I have had many names throughout history, all of them spoken with dread: Neltharion, Xaxas, and many more. Yet you shall know me best as Deathwing, for so I am! I am the bane of life, the darkness within history, the lord of death, the master of destruction. And I tell you now, and so it is true, that this world is mine!" - Neltharion, the Earth-Warder
One of Darmac's trained beasts, its tusks can pierce even the hardest Iron Horde steel.
One of Darmac's trained beasts, it was raised in a crucible of molten fire and shows no fear.
Stolen from the Arathi Basin stables, this fire-hearted charger now steeds for the Horde.
Captured in the snows of Alterac Valley, this bloodthirsty hunter now roars for the Alliance.
The rapid technological evolution of the descendents of Mimiron began with the introduction of a new gear, leading to such wonders as the tragically under-produced Model W.
When you really want to be noticed... and don't mind strapping yourself to a giant, barely-held-together wheel.
This daughter of the great direhorn loa, Torcali, never lost faith that her keeper would help her grow to her full potential.
The kind nature of alpacas makes them perfect as companions for the intrepid adventurer.
Keeps the peace by turning you into pieces.
You built this yourself, you should be proud, even though it's smoky, sparky, and loud.
"R E S I S T" is carved into the seat in crude letters, along with several, more profane things.
The snapdragon is a quiet hunter in the water, but is far less stealthy on land.
When a snapdragon bites you, the worry isn't about the bite itself, but the poison that will begin to eat away at the wound.
Gasses naturally stored within the creature allowed it to survive within the depths, those same gasses also allow them to effortlessly float through the air.
He emerges from the water, fins swaying lazily in the breeze, sun-kissed scales glittering. He is... Fabious.
The blood-red coloration of these creatures is ideal for hiding in large coral formations.
Schools of tidestallions will viciously slam their muscular chests into their prey to take them down.
This spawn of Vexiona, cleansed by Wrathion, comes from a flight with a fractured past and uncertain future.
Chiseled by the stonemasons of Stormwind, this stone gryphon symbolizes the unbending courage of the Alliance.
Chiseled by the stoneworkers of Orgrimmar, this stone wind rider is a symbol of the unwavering strength of the Horde.
Even the dead need a lift every now and then.
Even the dead need a lift every now and then.
Even the dead need a lift every now and then.
Even the dead need a lift every now and then.
The black serpents of N'Zoth are the harbingers of his ultimate vision becoming reality. Only those servents or enemies that can tread this space have any chance of wrangling them.
The best mount, logically, serves multiple purposes -- sometimes you need to get places AND reach something high up once you get there.
Raised in the Alterac Mountains by the Frostwolf Clan, trained to bite dwarves.
The canopy atop this dune-wanderer can be stored at your campsite, should you desire to feel the wind in your fur.
For when you're making a crash landing in the middle of an uncharted swamp because it's the only way to access that ancient temple.
The surly dunetrekker can easily carry a set of explorers to the nearest ruins and back without the need to rest.
Anima is a fundamental force that infuses the Shadowlands. It flows through many creatures, but is also traded, bartered for, and fought over.

The locals in Halfhill swear that whenever a batch of grain is missing, a farmworking instrument is misplaced, or a bushel of berries can't be found, you can hear a mischievous squeaking, and are reminded to slow down and accept what life gives you.
The Pandaren believe that merely rubbing one's hands on the shiny hide of the ox will grant prosperity, the challenge is catching it.
Raised in the Alterac Mountains by the Stormpike Clan, trained to headbutt orcs.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Drop:|r N'Zoth the Corruptor|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r Ny'alotha, the Waking City|n|cFFFFD200Difficulty:|r Mythic
Description_lang: To find him, drown yourself in the Circle of Stars.
The brood of Ha-Li are comfortable in the blue skies of Pandaria, hunting unsuspecting prey.

Once the loyal mount of a House Briarbane lord, it turned on the lord and his retinue. Members of House Briarbane now whisper of a dark Gargon lying in wait even baiting venthyr who venture through the darker parts of the Chalice District of Revendreth.

Prince Renathal's loyal gargon, Vrednic has been by his side for millennia. Adorned in his Sinvyr armor, Vrednic's mere presence instills terror to all those who lay eyes on him as he ushers his rider into battle.
Runestags are granted to those who have pledged their service to the Winter Queen and the Court of Night.
The majestic runestags are capable of siphoning anima from the ambient light of Ardenweald with their elaborate antlers. The anima is used as nourishment and to power the runestag's speed and magic.
Soulhunters are used to track wayward souls across the wastes that flee from their dark fates, and are one of the only creatures that feel comfortable traversing the maw.
The Darkwarren Hardshell's chitin is sturdy enough to withstand mortar shells and dragon's fire. It will also conviently consume anything lacking anima, if needed.
The ballads of Ardenweald claim that the birth of gloomrunner heralds the passing of a particularly benevolent wild god. Seeing a gloomrunner is therefore a blessing and a curse.
This sun-dappled courser gallops on lightbeams with carefree abandon.
These exceptionally agile fliers make excellent mounts once they've been trained not to sap every ounce of anima from their rider.
Harika the Horrid terrorized the denizens of the Forest Ward, and with her demise her broodlings can now take this horror to denizens farther afield.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Drop:|r Ivory Cloud Serpent|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r Vale of Eternal Blossoms
Description_lang: Ivory Cloud Serpents are often mistaken for roaring thunder as they tear through the skies with blistering speed.
It's the biggest murloc you've ever seen!
Fierce companions of the followers of Ra-den, the Rajani Warserpents are a force to be reckoned with.
Rocks erode, fires sputter, but wind remains powerful regardless of the passage of time. -Phaoris
Worming its way through the Postmaster's network, this serpent of N'Zoth deprived Azeroth of its primary magical correspondence.
Larger than most of its kin, this vulture has shown sick and strong beasts alike why they need to fear the skies.
Doubting a Wastewander Skyterror's capabilities is a quick way to find yourself missing a limb.
The Aqir drones feast on heroes and cowards alike to grow their ranks.
Void, jelly, and a very full belly is all this drone needs.
When the Void reached out, the Aqir were formed in its terrible image.
It's so wiggly! Just looking at it move is chaotic and unnerving.
The kind nature of alpacas makes them perfect as companions for the intrepid adventurer.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Achievement: |rBattle for Azeroth Keystone Master: Season Four|n|cFFFFD200Category: |rDungeons
Description_lang: It may look menacing right now, but it's actually kind of cute when it's asleep.
Houndlord Ren used his strongest quilen to carry him across Pandaria to subjugate the Vale for the Mogu empire.
The only thing stronger than a quilen's loyalty is its fierce devotion to making sure it covers its owner in kisses.
The kind nature of alpacas makes them perfect as companions for the intrepid adventurer.
The presence of the giant felines heralds the beginning of the end for the birds of Azeroth.

The moths of Ardenweald play a vital role in the ecosystem, carrying spores, anima, and pollen from one part of the forest to the other, providing nourishment and variation to the denizens living below.

A mad gnomish inventor had a dream to ride a dragon, so he created this metal monstrosity. He powered it with a trapped demon, in order to create "an authentic dragon soul," and did not survive its activation.
Only the most stalwart stable masters of Maldraxxus are able to break the will of the colossal slaughterclaws, giving all champions of the Undying Army a fearsome ally in the Shadowlands.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200PvP:|r Shadowlands: Season 1|nRated Arena and Rated Battleground Season Reward
Description_lang: When being a courageous member of the Alliance doesn't strike the right amount of fear into your opponent, add a giant spider.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200PvP:|r Shadowlands: Season 1|nRated Arena and Rated Battleground Season Reward
Description_lang: When being a bellowing member of the Horde doesn't strike the right amount of fear into your opponent, add a giant spider.
The shadeleaf runestag are bred for their ferocity as well as their beauty by the Wild Hunt. They feel no fear charging into the den of any predator.

Runestags enjoy lying near wildseeds. The Wakeners believe they can hear the sleepers' dreams. These runestags display a range of emotions in their vigil, signaling the dreams or nightmares of the spirits within.
Winterborn runestags are blessed by the Winter Queen herself. Their runes flare brilliantly when predators are nearby, warning the entire herd.

An shadeleaf runestag is capable of goring creatures as powerful as a gorm matriarch in defense of its herd. The Wild Hunt ride these mounts into dangerous corners of the Shadowlands, when their domain must be defended from those who would threaten the wilds.
Wakener runestags fiercely protect their wildseed groves. When the groves starting to fail, many runestags went berserk.
Winterborn runestags are the favored mount of the Winter Queen herself, and she only bestows such a creature on her most favored subjects.

Mischievous spriggans and the valerunners have a natural enmity. No valerunner would deign to allow a spriggan rider because they can sense their inherent malevolence. This angers the trickster spriggans who take twisted enjoyment in playing cruel pranks on these majestic creatures.
These ardenmoths prefer the dark and damp forests of northwest Ardenweald, where fungal colonies are perpetually blooming.
Spriggan riders tie bits of anima-less detritus to the end of sticks in front of their gorm mounts to steer. It's... an imperfect art.
This mount shows a proclivity for snacking upon the souls cast out of Revendreth.
The soldiers of Maldraxxus protect the Shadowlands, and require a mount that is both capable and calm when faced with overwhelming odds.
The tauralus is considered courageous, though scholars of Maldraxxus have long wondered if their lack of fear is simply due to the tiny size of their brains.
There are quite a few reasons that you do not want to stand behind a tauralus, the hooves and whip-like tails being the least of them.
Even an unarmored tauralus is a valuable ally in battle, its enormous horns capable of piercing even plate armor.

The tauralus that serve the armies of Maldraxxus have had all traits of compassion bred out of them, and are only adorned in armor when they show that no sword or spell can stop them from carrying their rider to victory.
When fully armored, a tauralus can take an incredible amount of damage before falling, making it a valuable ally in battle.
A favored mount of the House of the Chosen, the tauralus only gets more angry and vicious when exposed to battle.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Achievement: |rThings To Do When You're Dead|n|cFFFFD200Category: |rCovenant Sanctums
Description_lang: The tauralus has two tails, which are both absolutely necessary for whipping away buzzing pests like the bloodlouse.
The House of the Chosen train their mounts in all manner of difficult circumstances, so that no matter the battle, they will never falter.
Nerissa trampled over countless bodies on the back of Gorespine as she rose to prominence as the commander of the Lichsworn forces for the House of Rituals.
Only bloodtusks that survive the Contest of Conquest are deemed worthy enough to become a mount of the Undying Army.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rThe Ember Court|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rVenthyr|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rQueen's Conservatory|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rNight Fae|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rPath of Ascension|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rKyrian|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rAbomination Factory|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rNecrolord
Description_lang: Bred by the Revendreth prince, Renathal, these rare dredwing are fiercely loyal and will only let those deemed worthy by the prince himself to interact with them.
Roosting among the ramparts of Castle Nathria, these giant dredbats act as sentinels and are trained to take down threats approaching the castle from the air.
The dredwings of the Harvesters fear no mawsworn, and will gleefully sink their teeth into anything that threatens Sinfall.
Attracted through portals through which little is known these flying devourers have found a home in the Endmire of Revendreth feeding on the latent anima.

The gargon of the Inquisitors are some of the most vicious ever carved. The Avowed seek to recapture these beasts and return them to the righteous duty of assisting in the purifying of souls rather than the perversions performed at the hands of the Inquisitors.
The gargon are the loyal mounts and companions of the Venthyr and Renathal has found many abandoned at Sinfall, awaiting reawakening and assignment to worthy members of the covenant.
Loyal hounds of the Curator, these gargon patrol the crypts and catacombs deterring both trespassing and escape.

The Countess maintains a small stable of elegantly adorned gargon mounts for her sole use. Many a rival has been taken in by the finery to their peril as she personally oversees their deadly training.
Representative of a new loyal batch of gargon, these battle ready beasts will take Renathal's most loyal compatriots into the final battles against the Jailer.
Silessa fought valiantly alongside her master in the great incursion by the Light, following the battle her master set her to guard over a vault room of great value.

Crawling forth from the cracks between the realms, the devourers have a voracious appetite for anima. Little is known of their origins, but all denizens of the Shadowlands see their recent boldness as a sign of the end times.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rThe Ember Court|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rVenthyr|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rQueen's Conservatory|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rNight Fae|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rPath of Ascension|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rKyrian|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rAbomination Factory|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rNecrolord
Description_lang: The acid present in the ichor of this creature sapped away the color from its shell, leaving it a striking shade of snowy white.
This prowler's brilliant green coat distinguishes it from the blues and purples of Ardenweald, making it much easier for others of its kind to see through the midnight woods.
Some within the Ascended keep a phalynx as a pet. While they may not be as furry as a larion, they are much less likely to eat your other pets.
The phalynx does not fetch, though it is not known why this is.
A phalynx is considered both a worthy companion and a lithe opponent to test one's reflexes against.
The most precious cargo in all Ardenweald, the wildseeds, are cradled by this lovingly-crafted cart. It is imbued with anima to allow it to hover over the ground.
Little is known about the origination of phalynx technology, the machinations of which are taught more akin to religion than engineering.
The armored phalynx is a favorite companion of the mightiest warriors of the Ascended as it is both fearless and vicious in battle.
Many bars of gildenite are required to forge one of these sparkling mounts, but the sight of them alone is worth the gathering time.
A marvel of steward engineering, the armored phalynx is a rare and awe-inspiring sight.
When an armored phalynx is forged, stewards clap their hammers together in reverence of the skill required in its creation.
This gift of the silvery winds is only bestowed upon those that search high and low for the wisdom of Bastion.

With the death of the Jailer and the ascension of a new Arbiter, the Shadowlands is returning to its great Purpose. Some deathwalkers recognize the role that mortal heroes have played, and are willing to serve as mounts.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Drop:|r Nalthor the Rimebinder|n|cFFFFD200Zone: |rThe Necrotic Wake (Mythic)|n|n|cFFFFD200Drop:|r Challenger's Cache|n|cFFFFD200Zone: |rThe Necrotic Wake
Description_lang: Marrowfang, Bonefang's progeny, was respected by Amarth the Harvester for her insatiable appetite, even if it disrupted any experiments that the sadistic commander wanted to run.
Flayedwings are a necessary force in the cycle of life for the Shadowlands, acting as both prey and predator for the harsh environment of Maldraxxus.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rThe Ember Court|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rVenthyr|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rQueen's Conservatory|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rNight Fae|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rPath of Ascension|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rKyrian|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rAbomination Factory|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rNecrolord
Description_lang: The flayedwings of Maldraxxus are prized for their ability to soar effortlessly through the skies of the Shadowlands, allowing their rider a surprise opportunity to strike at their foes or support their allies.
Only expert flesh-stitchers who have demonstrated mastery over the magics of Maldraxxus are powerful enough to construct a deathroc of this size.
Deathrocs are stitched monstrosities from the discarded viscera, bone, and organs that were not required to construct soldiers for the House of Constructs.
Geiger's everlasting hunger is legendary amonst the House of Constructs, and no beast is too large or bony to fit inside its massive stomach.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rThe Ember Court|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rVenthyr|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rQueen's Conservatory|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rNight Fae|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rPath of Ascension|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rKyrian|n|n|cFFFFD200Covenant Feature: |rAbomination Factory|n|cFFFFD200Covenant: |rNecrolord
Description_lang: The Path of Ascension is a challenging trial, and those that display all of the facets the Kyrian hold dear will be duly rewarded.

In life, Blanchy appeared to be an affectionate, well-behaved horse of excellent disposition and appetite. What evils must she have committed in secret to have earned her place among the condemned souls of Revendreth?
The wood and foliage growing atop this toad is a natural part of its body, helping it siphon anima from the air to nourish itself.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Achievement:|r Flawless Master|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r Torghast, Tower of the Damned
Description_lang: The fate of all horse mounts.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Achievement:|r Glory of the Dominant Raider|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r Sanctum of Domination
Description_lang: The treachery of Hrestimorak was infamous, betraying his people to claim power. Facing damnation in the Maw, he tried to subvert the Jailer... a foolish act that would earn him an eternity of torment.
Forged from the sins of countless diabolical dungeon denizens. Only those with the skills to overcome them may hold its reins.
Umbral gorm are the most docile of all gorm, but they also grow the largest horns and mandibles. They are probably so docile because other creatures avoid riling them.

Sinrunners were once the steeds of dark souls, carried in the wake of either their sins or their masters' sins to Revendreth. While some chose to run free, many continue to serve darkness in death as they did in life.
These warhounds are crafted by the House of Constructs to carry any rider into the thick of battle, rending and tearing enemy mounts all the while.
The Forsworn and their mounts take on a darker aspect upon renouncing the path laid forth by the Archon. While tame enough to ride, the Highwind Darkmane has a fiercely independent streak.
He comes from the ice and snow, under the Azeroth sun where adventurers go.
The mighty larion is an apex predator of Bastion, but that does not stop it from enjoying a nice nap in the sunny fields.
Only those that have proven themselves against the combined might of the Ascended will be able to ride this mount.
The brilliant orange hue of the amber ardenmoth signals to predators that it is dangerous to eat. Consuming one of these creatures will put a predator into a dreamless sleep for years.
These minty green moths are very friendly. They particularly enjoy having their head fuzz vigorously brushed. They also enjoy music and poetry.
In service of the great Purpose, desertwing hunters were designed to fill distant skies of forgotten realms of the Shadowlands.
Looking at these majestic creatures, it's not difficult to see how the idea of cervids developed into the stags found on Azeroth and other mortal worlds.
A flutterer is an overgrown vespoid worker created to carry a rider. Rather than looking to a queen for leadership, it looks to its rider to guide it in all things.
As one of the last remaining polyps of an elusive creature, this aurelid is at home in the water as much as the air.
The aquilon can be a valuable ally in combat, with capabilities exceeding those of the phalynx.
Warhounds find comfort in conflict, and the Contest of Conquest is the perfect place to find these beasts honing their abilities.
The necrorays of Maldraxxus prefer to congregate around the enormous decaying mushrooms of the region.
Necrorays lay their eggs in small clusters within the frills and hollows of decaying fungal blooms.
When a necroray hatches, spores fly everywhere, making a huge mess.
Created by deciphering and performing powerful runic magic, this Shadehound is bound to its creator.
The loyal hounds of the Jailer creep along the corridors in search of the scent of souls.
The devourers are presumed to have their origins in the In-Between, a space between the lands of the Shadowlands that few have explored.
Hailing from a species already adept at natural camouflage, the otherworldly energies that transformed Draenor into Outland gave these creatures the ability to shift through space.
This mysterious creature lurks beneath the slime pools of Plaguefall. No one knows where it came from.
Brokers of all types use these gliders to travel around Tazavesh and similar nearby outposts, and carry their goods as well.
These beautiful helicids emerge only at night. When they are pleased, their shells hum with a joyful melody.
To be the Lord of the Corpseflies, you've got to lay a LOT of eggs.
The hide of the razorwing is light, allowing it to fly, but also quite tough, allowing them to survive passage into the Maw.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200PvP:|r Shadowlands: Season 3|nRated Arena and Rated Battleground Season Reward
Description_lang: These creatures are so enthusiastic when charging into battle that they will croak out something that sounds very much like "FOR THE HORDE!"

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200PvP:|r Shadowlands: Season 3|nRated Arena and Rated Battleground Season Reward
Description_lang: These creatures are so enthusiastic when charging into battle that they will croak out something that sounds very much like "FOR THE ALLIANCE!"

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Drop:|r Supplies of the Archivist's Codex|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r Korthia |n
Description_lang: When it comes to taming devourers, all it takes is a little anima and a lot of patience. And a lot of healing potions.
These shardhides find it easy to hide in the underbrush, and it is rare to find one that is tamed.
These brilliant blue birds burn brighter (and hotter) than their orange cousins, though the origin of both remains a mystery.
A staunch defender of the forests of Azeroth, the ancients are also known for their glorious canopies of leaves, which change color with the seasons.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200PvP:|r Shadowlands: Season 2|nRated Arena and Rated Battleground Season Reward
Description_lang: The gorm love eating the corpses of your enemies, so this seemed like a natural fit.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200PvP:|r Shadowlands: Season 2|nRated Arena and Rated Battleground Season Reward
Description_lang: The gorm love eating the corpses of your enemies, so this seemed like a natural fit.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200PvP:|r Shadowlands: Season 4|nRated Arena and Rated Battleground Season Reward
Description_lang: Trample the Horde to dust while riding a majestic protoform wolf! For the Alliance!

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200PvP:|r Shadowlands: Season 4|nRated Arena and Rated Battleground Season Reward
Description_lang: Trample the Alliance to dust while riding a majestic protoform wolf! For the Horde!
It is a great honor to be trusted with one of the Maruuk's loyal hunting companions. This Bruffalon is reliable and steadfast through any hardship.
Who's a good little new-forged snail made entirely of elemental lava? You are! Yes, you!

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Drop:|r Lady Sylvanas Windrunner|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r Sanctum of Domination|n|cFFFFD200Difficulty:|r Mythic
Description_lang: Sylvanas lost a part of herself the day Arthas took her life, and the darkness within her grew to fill the void.
The most wicked and cruel of her kin, Bahmethra endured the full measure of the Banished One's punishments before her fall.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Drop:|r War Chest of the Wild Hunt|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r The Maw
Description_lang: Integrated into the depleted forces of the Wild Hunt, the fawn riders quickly found that the gorm's powerful mandibles were perfect for cutting down close enemy ranks.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Drop:|r War Chest of the Undying Army|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r The Maw
Description_lang: The Undying Darkhound's parts have graced many battlefields, yet this latest battle may have been the first time they all fought together.

The instability of primalist storms in potential timelines sometimes causes creatures to absorb the energies from the very storms. These creatures tend to be docile towards those who are able to face the fury of these chronomatic anomalies.
This soul eater's gaze unnerves you. Best not meet its eyes for too long.
Only the richest cartel leaders are able to afford the metals required to craft the Cartel Master's Gearglider.
As anima flows to the distant wealds of Ardenweald once more, the wilderlings awaken and cautiously emerge from their canopy burrows.
The wilderlings are benevolent, magical creatures of Ardenweald, and are drawn to souls that are strong and pure.
Wilderlings serve as support units in battle, preserving their allies and rendering enemy magics useless.
Stubborn and rebellious, this wilderling is loyal to very few. But those few are bonded for life.
In the darkened skies of Revendreth, you cannot see these creatures coming until it is too late.
With anima once again flowing in Sinfall, the Stonewright has been able to infuse these Stoneborn, making them valuable allies in the battles to come.
Gravewings know no fear and are nearly indestructible -- perfect for an assault on the Maw.
With anima once again flowing to the Eternal Forge in Bastion, the plans for the aquilon centurion could be crafted once more.
Originally produced by the Forsworn with stolen blueprints, these powerful centurion are now earning a reputation across the Shadowlands.
The aquilon can rapidly transport aspirants, stewards, and even ascended to a location. Hey, sometimes your wings get tired.
Corpseflies were once found throughout Maldraxxus, but many died out in the absence of anima. With anima flowing once again, they swarm.
Only the forces of Maldraxxus would call a corpsefly "regal."
Corpseflies are strongly attracted to the smell of dead bodies and will swarm an active battlefield as soon as the first corpse falls.
Only the Jailer's most powerful lieutenants are gifted these steeds to stalk the halls of the Tower.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Drop:|r Mysterious Gift from Ve'nari|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r The Maw
Description_lang: Ve'nari has many methods of sneaking around the Maw and disrupting the Jailer's plans, including binding his own minions.
The charger's screams echo across the Maw as it continues a never-ending ride across the land, forever looking for escape from the endless torments it has been forced to endure.

Of all the giants who dared defy the Jailer, Nilganihmaht was the most arrogant. For this transgression, the giant's severed hand was hidden within a veil of torments, and the rings that could summon it back were scattered across the Maw.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Achievement:|r Breaking the Chains|n|cFFFFD200Zone:|r Korthia and The Maw
Description_lang: Salaranga was the most cunning of her kin and hid amongst the Beastwarrens. She struck at the Banished One with a horde of bestial allies. It did not matter.
The bright colors of Korthian wildlife indicate that they have either few predators, or are tough enough to fight back.
When Korthia was pulled into the maw, only a few hardy species survived.
An older shardhide, Darkmaul was relatively tame and friendly around Korthians. He was thought lost to the calamity.
Razorwings generally stay away from other Korthian species, but with time and patience, they can be tamed as well.
Korthia was once known for its bright red flowers. Several species were known for consuming or rolling in them, and taking on bright red coloration as a result.
Razorwings can be seen throughout Korthia, making their nests on high hills and in trees.
A curious and inquisitive doe, she doesn't mean to worry her master, she just gets distracted easily. Especially with all of the new things to see on Korthia.
Hold on a sec, Sarge isn't that large, someone must have spun a tall tale in the Hearthstone Tavern...
One would think controlling a rampaging mount would be difficult, but if you can learn to control the direction of the rampage it can be quite useful.
A howling vortex of tormented souls, ridden only by those who wish to demonstrate their impressive tolerance for pain and suffering.
These majestic hippogryphs are as close to a being of the Emerald Dream as any resident of Azeroth can be, and do not bond with a rider easily.
The Enlightened revere all creations of the First Ones, yet for many, the vombata of Zereth Mortis are the most beloved. These creatures are equal parts trusted beast of burden and beloved companion.
Most vombata enjoy tunneling through the ground, but these sniffers seem to have an unerring ability to locate crystals buried deep underground and will congregate around large deposits.

The schematic to synthesize these darkened vombata seem to have appeared as a reaction to the Mawsworn invasion. The resulting vombata look different--darker, much like the invaders--but behave normally.
Red-colored vombata are considered lucky by the Enlightened. It was a red vombata that was present when they first arrived in Zereth Mortis.
These wild cervids are only truly at peace when running through--or between--the lands of Death.

Whatever the purpose of these cervids once was, it is long forgotten. Though they are not Dominated, they have been corrupted by the unintended presence of Mawsworn in the sacred realm of Zereth Mortis.
Only those most esteemed by the Enlightened are trusted with the reins of this rare cervid.

The rivers of Pandaria, like Wen Lo, are unpredictable in nature. They may remain calm, bringing water to the crops, or flood, bringing ruin. Wen Lo reminds us that we must adapt to the challenges of life.
In the forgotten depths of the Dalaran library, this oversized tome was found flapping madly around the room. Open the pages of this arcane-infused book and hitch a ride to magical adventure.
There's nothing that can make you feel as alive quite like riding through the realm of Death while atop a being that hates you.
Buzz buzz buzz, buzz buzz! Buzz buzz buzz buzz buzz. Buzz buzz buzz, buzz buzz buzz.

Bronzewing vespoids are the result of attempting to synthesize a vespoid queen with no other members of a new hive. While no mortal has yet discovered how to synthesize a hive, the bronzewings are reliable mounts just as they are.
Since the Jailer's incursion, new raptora have been synthesized by Zereth Mortis that are capable of resisting the corrupting influence of the Maw.

The raptora swooper is one of the most vicious iterations of its kind, perfectly suited for its ecological niche. Needing no further adjustments, the ones synthesized today are identical to those created in the past.

Some helicids of Zereth Mortis have strangely metallic shells. The ones who do are generally a bronze color, indistinct from the metal any novice miner could work, save that this creature's construction far surpasses the skill of any novice.
This creature was not designed by the First Ones, but instead by an unknown being attempting to create a very fast runner. Needless to say the attempt failed, because this mount is very slow.
This helicid's unusual reddish tint is clearly intentional in its design, but the only other difference between these and other helicids is the unusual lack of any ooze.
The Enlightened who have observed tarachnids believe that this variety may be some of the first beings to ever walk the land of Zereth Mortis.
These tarachnids make their home in the darkest corners of Zereth Mortis, coming out only to hunt (or, sometimes, carry a rider around).
These tarachnids move with a purpose unknown to others, answering only to a higher calling. Whatever that may be, it appears to include routine assistance to mortals who need a ride. For now.
Raw swirling energy bound together into a cohesive form, it will only bend to the will of those strong enough to bind it.
...as though welcomed by the wind itself.
There are no guarantees when you purchase an ottuk from Tattukiaka. At least they're cute.
This armored bufonid is always ready to leap into battle... as long as that battle is really, really close. In a pinch, it can leap multiple times and eventually reach the battle.
Though it was once created to defend the Sepulcher of the First Ones, with its primary function now completed, it now obediently follows your command.
The Cyphers of the First Ones are beyond any mortal understanding. A curious effect of the language is that, for reasons unknown, some aurelids are drawn to mortals who aspire to unlock its mystery.

The few of these mysterious creatures that remain appear to be impossibly old, almost timeless. Perhaps they were created by the First Ones, because no schematic to synthesize these has yet been discovered.
It's difficult to tell because it's far too angry, but this slyvern is actually glad it's not owned by gnolls anymore.
The last of the sleepers are finally awakening, bringing the dreams of the dragons back to the lands.
The drakes of Azure Span follow a strict personal code of honor as they explore the isles anew.
The incredible prowess you have demonstrated within the Jailer's Tower has instilled sufficient respect into this fearsome creature, enabling its use as a mount.
This disturbingly large Mawrat is an anomaly amongst its species. These Colossal Mawrats lurk only in the most distant and darkest reaches of Torghast.
This vicious and cunning creature has grown to its astonishing size by not only feasting upon the weakened souls in the Jailer's Tower, but also vulnerable Mawsworn.
A loyal steed to the Lightforged Draenei.
Some bufonids will sit perfectly still for hours or days at a time if left to their own devices. Fortunately, they're also quite agreeable if a rider would like to move more often than that.
An ancient schematic allows for the instantiation of this early, but functional, bufonid design.
Russet is a rare color among bufonids that is normally only seen on specimens that are tainted by other cosmic forces, or synthesized from a perplexing schematic that invokes that color.
This soul eater's gaze unnerves you. Best not meet its eyes for too long.
More affectionate than their cousins, Magenta Cloud Serpents are known to form close bonds with their riders.
This rare giant crab has taken a break from its nautical nonsense deep under the sea to explore the surface.
Squawks's older (and somehow louder) brother appears to tolerate your presence. For now. You should probably track down some crackers while you still can.
It's unclear how the saddle stays atop this formerly feline friend, but somehow the House of Plagues made it work. Science.
Kaldorei legends whisper of a relentless hunter prowling amongst the deepest shadows of Kalimdor, never sleeping. By the light of the sun or the moon, Ash'adar now hunts with you.
This species of ray seems to have evolved to stalk its prey amidst the brightly colored corals of the seas.
From the moment of its creation, this packless lupine has held nothing more than deepest affection and loyalty towards you.
Few mana wyrms find sufficiently stable sources of arcane power to reach such a size. A greatwyrm's appetite for mana is unmatched.
Only the strongest and most fearless of kodos can be trained to become living siege weapons. Even the highest walls won't keep them out for long.
These rodents became Iska's infamous sentries, scouting and carrying her plague across the Maw. Their presence is only followed by ruin.
Infused by the energies of tormented souls, these creatures have adopted ghostlike abilities that make them quite elusive.
Many an unwary direhorn has met its end in a flash of glittering gold before becoming this pterrordax's next meal.
Enigmatic and aloof, this construct of the First Ones flies on a graceful stream of perfect geometric understanding.
These drakes feel at home in the depths of the earth and the far reaches of the sky.
As the isles awaken, these proto-drakes answer the call to soar the skies alongside mortals.
The long talons of the velocidrake give it an edge on the plains.
Often roosting along the steep cliff faces of Thaldraszus, they're swift to the skies in times of danger.

The presence of this majestic Pandaren rabbit spirit brings joy and happiness and is heralded as a wonderful omen. Legend says that in its eyes, you can glimpse the greatest happiness of your life, even if it is yet to come.
Gottum's expansion into export markets was inevitable with news of the Trading Post reaching even into the depths of the Frogmarsh.
The fearsome beast ridden by Astaroth himself is now yours to command.
Otherwise known as The Flame Woof, the Fetcher of the Igneous, Molten Core's Best Friend, Forgehound Maximus, the Best Fiery Boy, and "oh no is that an AXE on his face!?"
This soul eater's gaze unnerves you. Best not meet its eyes for too long.
Unseen for many years, this brightly hued hawkstrider emerged from hiding to help defend the Ghostlands from the Scourge. Its prowess shines as brilliantly as its feathers.
The Tuskarr learned long ago that some of the bones of the sea creatures they hunted were light and buoyant, making for effective glider materials.
NYI
Even the dead need a lift every now and then.
Liberated from the Qalashi and harnessed by your ingenuity (and your harness), this magmammoth is ready to lava stomp wherever you want to go.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Faction:|r Dragonscale Expedition|n|cFFFFD200Renown:|r 25|n|cFFFFD200Vendor:|r Granpap Whiskers|n|cFFFFD200Location:|r Dragonscale Basecamp
Description_lang: It didn't take long for Granpap Whiskers to tame the skitterflies around the Dragonscale Basecamp and set them to helping move Expedition personnel and cargo.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Faction:|r Dragonscale Expedition|n|cFFFFD200Renown:|r 25|n|cFFFFD200Vendor:|r Granpap Whiskers|n|cFFFFD200Location:|r Dragonscale Basecamp|n|cFFFFD200Cost:|r 5|Hitem:201401|h|TInterface\ICONS\INV_Icon_Feather05d.BLP:0|t|h 20|Hitem:193053|h|TInterface\ICONS\INV_Feather_11.blp:0|t|h 750|Hcurrency:2003|h|TInterface\ICONS\INV_Faction_WarResources.BLP:0|t|h
Description_lang: Once Granpap Whiskers finally taught them how to take riders, the azure skitterflies proved to bond closely and loyally to their riders.
Verdant skitterflies are the perfect mount for the scouts of the Dragonscale Expedition scouts, as they are fast and blend into the foliage of the Dragon Isles.
Due to their preference for dark caves and murky waters, sightings of this unique breed of salamanther are so rare that many researchers thought they had gone extinct.
Sometimes when storm energies infuse a creature, it simply... becomes larger and more placid. Few salamanthers are willing to be ridden, but these children of the storm are a notable exception.
Drawn forth from its abyss by the rage of the Zaqali.
Fed by victory and hardened by glory, this snail is nothing less than a tribute to mastery.
Formed from the leftover elemental energies of the Primal Storms, this magical mollusk is faster than it appears.
For the Worldbreakers, a portable footstool. For you, a hardy mount.
Preserved for thousands of years in stone, bronze magic has nearly aged this mammoth back into a fossil.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200World Event:|r Centaur Hunts (first hunt of each week)
Description_lang: The mammoths of the Ohn'ahran Plains are unaccustomed to carrying people, as their centaur neighbors do not typically ride mounts. They can learn to bear riders, however. Some even do so enthusiastically.
Nothing will stop Lizi from her mission to eat all the world's fruit.
Most lava flows. This lava charges.
The tuskarr of Iskaara are loathe to war against anyone, but many tuskarr and their allies have nonetheless taken up the spear with a war ottuk beside them.
Some ottuks get into the spirit of carrying people around more than others.
The yellow ottuks of the Azure Span are sleek, sneaky, and smart. Those trained for war are the finest tuskarr cavalry mounts, equally capable on the ground and in the waters.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Quest:|r The Way to an Otto's Heart|n
Description_lang: Relax. The future will unfold as it was meant to, one way or an otter.
Wily and playful in their natural habitat, ottuks possess keen eyes that can scout far afield as ably as they watch for predators.
No adult knows why some ottuks are white, but any tuskarr child can tell you: it's because they eat too much snow.
The yellow scouting ottuk love to hide and they blend in well to their surroundings. When not 'playing' hide and seek with their riders, they are perfect companions when scouting enemy encampments.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Achievement:|r Gladiator: Dragonflight Season 1|n|cFFFFD200Category:|r Player vs. Player
Description_lang: Forged in the fires of conquest, and armored to the teeth.

Once a simple beetle of the Forbidden Reach, Telix became infused with storm magic when Raszageth was unleashed. With its newly heightened senses, Telix roams the Dragon Isles alongside the Dragonscale Expedition--and you!
Trained using ancient dracthyr methods, these armored vorquin are the pinnacle of tactical mounted ground warfare.
Trained using ancient dracthyr methods, these armored vorquin are the pinnacle of tactical mounted ground warfare.
Trained using ancient dracthyr methods, these armored vorquin are the pinnacle of tactical mounted ground warfare.
Trained using ancient dracthyr methods, these armored vorquin are the pinnacle of tactical mounted ground warfare.
The hardest winds begin with a gust and a flap.
Slyverns are rarely comfortable acting as mounts. Only those willing to feed their gluttonous appetites and keep a careful eye on them should attempt to ride.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Promotion:|r Wrath of the Lich King Classic|n
Description_lang: The same magic of undeath that raised the Frostbrood into the Lich King's service has infused this primal wyrm. Its loyalty and ferocity now serve those who defend Azeroth.
Born in the middle of an ice storm, this armoredon prefers its meals partially frozen.
Respected for their resilience in battle, even against dragonfire, these noble beasts are the prized mounts of the dracthyr cavalry.
Respected for their resilience in battle, even against dragonfire, these noble beasts are the prized mounts of the dracthyr cavalry.

Description_lang: The elite Alliance forces that use these sabertooth mounts use a battle cry that translates from Darnassian as "here kitty kitty".

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200PvP:|r Dragonflight: Season 1|nRated Arena and Rated Battleground Season Reward
Description_lang: The elite Horde forces that use these sabertooth mounts use a battle cry that translates from Thalassian as "pspspspsps".
The salesgoblin always tells people about the RS-9001's huge variety of attachments, but somehow neglects to mention that you never get to pick the attachments it'll have when you mount up.
Its tail smells like campfire but its breath smells like brimstone.
Big heart, big dreams, Big Slick.
Brood of Kairoktra, raised in the underlight of Zaralek Cavern.
Born from the magma, its carapce was originaly molten blobs cooled to form highly vesicular, dark-colored volcanic rock.
These sporebats have been specially trained to carry large amounts of Bartering Boulders for the Niffen's bartering activities.
A breed of sporebats trained by the Niffen to find the deepest of morsels.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200Achievement:|r Gladiator: Dragonflight Season 2|n|cFFFFD200Category:|r Player vs. Player
Description_lang: This mischievous drake enjoys flying through geysers and volcanic plumes.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200PvP:|r Dragonflight: Season 2|nRated Arena and Rated Battleground Season Reward
Description_lang: The Alliance uses these ravenous snail mounts to traverse over any obstacle in battlefields.

SourceText_lang: |cFFFFD200PvP:|r Dragonflight: Season 2|nRated Arena and Rated Battleground Season Reward
Description_lang: The Horde uses these ravenous snail mounts to traverse over any obstacle in battlefields.
